title: Yongnuo's mirrorless camera runs Android and supports Canon lenses
description:
![Yongnuo
YN450](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Mirrorless cameras still trump smartphones in every way except photographic
convenience, but wouldn’t it be great if you could combine the connectivity of
an Android phone with a Micro Four Thirds camera? That’s what Chinese company
Yongnuo has attempted with its forthcoming YN450.**

Unlike the [Samsung Galaxy
Camera](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-camera) from
2013, the Yongnuo YN450 is more camera-meets-Android phone than vice versa.

It has a 16-megapixel Four Thirds sensor, which on paper puts it in the
ballpark of something like the [Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark
III](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/olympus-om-d-e-m10-mark-iii), and
runs Android 7.1 Nougat, putting it a couple of years behind today’s flagship
phones.

Still, it’s an interesting combination if you fancy combining the dynamic
range and low light skills of a Four Thirds sensor with the ability to
immediately fire shots to Instagram without needing a phone in between.

**Related:**[Google Pixel 3 vs iPhone XS: which smartphone has the best
camera?](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/google-pixel-3-vs-iphone-xs-
camera-3610139)

Unlike dedicated cameras, the YN450 also features a front-facing, 8-megapixel
camera for shooting quick selfies. And Yongnuo’s [Facebook
post](https://www.facebook.com/hkyongnuo/photos/a.335615296586611/1177129062435226/?type=3&__tn__=-R)
also says the camera will support Canon EF lenses, which makes it an even more
unusual combination of sensor, mount and operating system.

Elsewhere, you get similar specs to a mid-range Android phone, with a five-
inch 1080p screen, GPS and 32GB of internal storage (which you can expand by
another 32GB).
